title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0001
text: What is a class in Java?
explanation: A class is a blueprint or template used to create objects in Java.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0002
text: Which keyword is used to define a class in Java?
explanation: The 'class' keyword is used to define a class in Java.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0003
text: Which of the following can a class contain?
explanation: A class can contain fields, methods, constructors, and nested classes.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0004
text: What is an object in relation to a class?
explanation: An object is an instance of a class created using the 'new' keyword.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0005
text: Which of the following is true about class members?

options.text: They can be variables or methods

explanation: Class members include variables (fields) and methods.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0006
text: Which of the following is used to create an object of a class?
explanation: The 'new' keyword is used to create an object of a class.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0007
text: Which of the following is true about constructors in a class?
explanation: Constructors are used to initialize objects when they are created.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0008
text: What is the default access modifier for a class in Java?
explanation: If no access modifier is specified, the class has package-private access.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0009
text: Which of the following statements about a class is true?

options.text: A class can have multiple constructors
A class can have only one constructor

explanation: A class can have multiple constructors with different parameter lists (constructor overloading).

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0010
text: Which of the following is true about static members of a class?

options.text: They belong to the class, not to any object
They belong to each object separately
They cannot be accessed without an object

explanation: Static members belong to the class itself and are shared among all objects.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0011
text: Which of the following is true about instance variables?

options.text: They are shared among all objects
Each object has its own copy

explanation: Each object has its own copy of instance variables.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0012
text: Which of the following is true about static methods?

options.text: They can access instance variables directly
They can be called without creating an object

explanation: Static methods can be called without creating an object of the class.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0013
text: Which of the following is true about the 'this' keyword?

options.text: It refers to the current object
It refers to the parent class
It refers to the static context
It refers to the class itself

explanation: The 'this' keyword refers to the current object of the class.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0014
text: Which of the following is true about the 'new' keyword?

options.text: It allocates memory for an object

explanation: The 'new' keyword allocates memory for an object and calls its constructor.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0015
text: Which of the following is true about nested classes?

options.text: They are classes defined within another class
They cannot access outer class members

explanation: Nested classes are classes defined within another class.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0016
text: Which of the following is true about inner classes?

options.text: They can access outer class members
They cannot access outer class members

explanation: Inner classes can access members of the outer class, including private ones.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0017
text: Which of the following is true about anonymous classes?

options.text: They can extend a class or implement an interface
They are defined and instantiated in a single expression

explanation: Anonymous classes have no name, can extend a class or implement an interface, and are defined in a single expression.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0018
text: Which of the following is true about abstract classes?

options.text: They can have abstract and non-abstract methods
They are declared using the 'abstract' keyword

explanation: Abstract classes cannot be instantiated, can have both abstract and non-abstract methods, and are declared using the 'abstract' keyword.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0019
text: Which of the following is true about final classes?
explanation: Final classes cannot be subclassed or extended.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0020
text: Which of the following is true about the Object class?

options.text: It is the superclass of all classes in Java
It is a subclass of String

explanation: The Object class is the root superclass of all classes in Java.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0021
text: Which of the following methods is defined in the Object class?
explanation: The Object class defines methods like toString(), equals(), and hashCode().

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0022
text: Which of the following is true about class inheritance?

options.text: A class can inherit from only one superclass
A class can inherit from multiple superclasses
A class cannot inherit from another class
A class can inherit from multiple interfaces only

explanation: Java supports single inheritance for classes but multiple inheritance through interfaces.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0023
text: Which keyword is used to inherit a class?
explanation: The 'extends' keyword is used to inherit a class in Java.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0024
text: Which keyword is used to call the parent class constructor?
explanation: The 'super' keyword is used to call the parent class constructor.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0025
text: Which of the following is true about the 'super' keyword?

options.text: It refers to the parent class object
It refers to the current object
It refers to the static context

explanation: The 'super' keyword refers to the parent class object.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0026
text: Which of the following is true about constructors?

options.text: They have the same name as the class

explanation: Constructors have the same name as the class and no return type.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0027
text: Which of the following is true about default constructors?

options.text: They are provided automatically if no constructor is defined

explanation: If no constructor is defined, Java provides a default no-argument constructor.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0028
text: Which of the following is true about parameterized constructors?

options.text: They accept arguments to initialize objects

explanation: Parameterized constructors accept arguments to initialize object fields.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0029
text: Which of the following is true about constructor overloading?

options.text: A class can have multiple constructors with different parameter lists
A class can have only one constructor
Constructors must have the same parameters

explanation: Constructor overloading allows multiple constructors with different parameter lists.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0030
text: Which of the following is true about the 'final' keyword in classes?
explanation: A final class cannot be extended by another class.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0031
text: Which of the following is true about static nested classes?

options.text: They do not require an instance of the outer class
They require an instance of the outer class
They cannot access static members of the outer class

explanation: Static nested classes do not require an instance of the outer class.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0032
text: Which of the following is true about inner classes?

options.text: They require an instance of the outer class
They cannot access outer class members

explanation: Inner classes require an instance of the outer class to be instantiated.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0033
text: Which of the following is true about encapsulation in classes?

options.text: It hides data using private variables and public methods

explanation: Encapsulation hides data using private variables and provides access through public methods.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0034
text: Which of the following is true about data hiding?

options.text: It restricts direct access to class fields
It allows direct access to class fields

explanation: Data hiding restricts direct access to class fields using access modifiers.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0035
text: Which of the following is true about access modifiers in classes?

options.text: They control visibility of class members

explanation: Access modifiers control the visibility of class members.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0036
text: Which of the following access modifiers allows access from anywhere?
explanation: The public access modifier allows access from anywhere in the program.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0037
text: Which of the following access modifiers restricts access to the same class only?
explanation: The private access modifier restricts access to the same class only.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0038
text: Which of the following access modifiers allows access within the same package?
explanation: The default access modifier allows access within the same package.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0039
text: Which of the following access modifiers allows access in subclasses and same package?
explanation: The protected access modifier allows access in subclasses and within the same package.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0040
text: Which of the following is true about method overloading?

options.text: Methods with the same name but different parameters
Methods with the same name and same parameters
Methods with different return types only

explanation: Method overloading occurs when methods have the same name but different parameter lists.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0041
text: Which of the following is true about method overriding?

options.text: A subclass provides a specific implementation of a superclass method
A subclass hides a superclass method
A subclass changes the method name

explanation: Method overriding allows a subclass to provide a specific implementation of a superclass method.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0042
text: Which of the following is true about the 'final' keyword in methods?
explanation: A final method cannot be overridden by subclasses.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0043
text: Which of the following is true about abstract methods?

options.text: They must be implemented by subclasses
They are declared using the 'abstract' keyword

explanation: Abstract methods have no body, must be implemented by subclasses, and are declared using 'abstract'.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0044
text: Which of the following is true about static blocks?

options.text: They are executed when the class is loaded
They are executed when an object is created

explanation: Static blocks are executed when the class is loaded, before any constructor.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0045
text: Which of the following is true about instance blocks?

options.text: They are executed before constructors for each object
They are executed before static blocks

explanation: Instance blocks are executed before constructors for each object creation.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0046
text: Which of the following is true about class loading?

options.text: Classes are loaded by the ClassLoader
Classes are loaded manually by the programmer
Classes are loaded only at compile time
Classes are not loaded in Java

explanation: The ClassLoader loads classes dynamically at runtime.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0047
text: Which of the following is true about the main() method?

options.text: It is the entry point of a Java program

explanation: The main() method is static, returns void, and serves as the entry point of a Java program.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0048
text: Which of the following is true about object creation?

options.text: Objects are created using the 'new' keyword
Objects are created using constructors only
Objects are created using static methods only

explanation: Objects are created using the 'new' keyword, which calls the constructor.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0049
text: Which of the following is true about garbage collection?
explanation: Garbage collection automatically deletes unused objects to free memory.

title: JavaOOPClasses - Q0050
text: Which of the following best describes a class in OOP?

options.text: A blueprint for creating objects with attributes and behaviors
A single instance of an object

explanation: A class is a blueprint for creating objects that define attributes and behaviors.
